article: During the last fifteen years of my mother's life she suffered with Alzheimer's disease . Until then she had been a bright, _ woman deeply interested and involved in the world around her. "In California," I would tell her. "Isn't that interesting," she would say, "I have a son in California." I _ my mother there was a little girl playing with the pet lamb she had been so fond of. I looked to her for some _ . She shook her head and said, "I want to go home."
